meanings.sent1: The tumescing balloon looked ready to burst.
meanings.sent2: Her tumescing ankle made it difficult to put on shoes.
meanings.sent3: The tumescing cheeks of the chipmunk made it look like it was storing extra food.
meanings.sent4: The tumescing river threatened to overflow its banks.
meanings.sent5: The tumescing clouds signaled an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The bee sting left her finger tumescing and painful.
meanings.sent2: His injured knee was tumescing rapidly after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The balloon kept tumescing until it popped with a loud bang.
meanings.sent4: Emotions were tumescing within him, ready to burst out.
meanings.sent5: The fruit started tumescing as it ripened on the tree.

meanings.definition: The act of swelling or becoming swollen.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the tumescing was a normal part of the healing process.
meanings.sent2: She felt the tumescing of her lips after eating something spicy.
meanings.sent3: The tumescing of the balloon made the children excited for it to pop.
meanings.sent4: The tumescing of the crowd indicated growing anticipation for the concert.
meanings.sent5: The tumescing of the river caused concern for potential flooding.
